Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2019 05:16PM ComeOn2019 wrote: As stated above, it depends first on how many “light up” after the injection. But it’s also not a 100% exact science. My surgeon said he got my SN and two teeny tiny others came out with it, so while he was shooting for one I had three removed.
Posts.Title: How Is it Decided How many Lymph Nodes to Remove and Test? kec1972 santabarbarian

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2018 09:45PM ComeOn2019 wrote: I am 38 and have no genetic markers either. However I have a paternal great aunt who was dx’d Post menopause and my dad’s sister was also recently dx’d post meno BUT hers is bilateral. I originally planned to just do lumpectomy (my CA is triple positive, btw), but have decided on bilateral MX for peace of mind. I know nothing will ever give us complete peace of mind, but I figure having no breast tissue is about as close as I’m gonna get. ü§∑üèª‚ôÄÔ∏è
